New Records: Lisandro Martínez scored the opening goal for Argentina in the 34th minute with a header from a corner kick.
Enner Valencia missed a crucial penalty kick for Ecuador in the first half.
Lionel Messi played a key role but didn't score, extending his minutes played record in Copa América history.
Key Match Events: Argentina scored the first goal of the match in the 34th minute through a set piece.
Ecuador missed a penalty kick in the first half.
Kevin Rodríguez scored a stoppage-time header to send Ecuador to penalties.
Argentina won the penalty shootout 4-2 to advance to the semifinals.
The match ended in a 1-1 draw after extra time.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina advanced to the semifinals after a tense penalty shootout victory.
The match highlighted defensive struggles and key set-piece opportunities for both teams.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a defensive battle with few clear chances until stoppage time.
The penalty shootout was a deciding factor in the outcome.
